Description: Body fragment of probably Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel; reserved inside. Sphinx to left on exterior; incised rosettes for filling ornament. The clay is smoothed on the surface, but has large inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 92 no. 319 pl. 69)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2010)
